title: Mathematics Learning Design Considering Cognitive Load and Working Memory

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical computation skills and self-directed learning experience
context.additional_context: Flexible learning environment utilizing an online platform, accessible for working professionals during evenings/weekends.

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish three types of cognitive load (intrinsic, extraneous, and germane) by applying system-model-based design principles.
Learners can analyze page design elements considering working memory (WM) capacity and propose two or more strategies to reduce distractions.
Learners can construct a basic model simulating the interaction between cognitive load and working memory using a stock-and-flow diagram.

resources: Personal BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) Devices

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
